getBlendSrcFunc().Description: Specifies how the source blending factor is computed

getBlendDstFunc().Description: Specifies how the destination blending factor is computed

isColorMaskBlueEnabled().Description: Queries whether blue channel is written

Parameters: Context to which the program will belong.
BLEND_NONE_DEPTH_NONE(android.renderscri.Description: Returns a pre-defined program store object with the following characteristics: - incoming pixels always pass the depth test and their value is not stored in the depth buffer - incoming pixels override the value stored in the color buffer

Parameters: Context to which the program will belong.
BLEND_NONE_DEPTH_TEST(android.renderscri.Description: Returns a pre-defined program store object with the following characteristics: - incoming pixels are drawn if their depth value is less than the stored value in the depth buffer. If the pixel is drawn, its value is also stored in the depth buffer - incoming pixels override the value stored in the color buffer if it passes the depth test

isColorMaskRedEnabled().Description: Queries whether red channel is written

isColorMaskGreenEnabled().Description: Queries whether green channel is written

isColorMaskAlphaEnabled().Description: Queries whether alpha channel is written

getDepthFunc().Description: Returns the function used to test writing into the depth buffer

Parameters: Context to which the program will belong.
BLEND_ALPHA_DEPTH_NONE(android.renderscr.Description: Returns a pre-defined program store object with the following characteristics: - incoming pixels always pass the depth test and their value is not stored in the depth buffer - incoming pixel's value is combined with the stored color (Dest) using the following formula Final.RGB = Source.RGB * Source.A + Dest.RGB * (1 - Source.A)

Parameters: Context to which the program will belong.
BLEND_ALPHA_DEPTH_TEST(android.renderscr.Description: Returns a pre-defined program store object with the following characteristics: - incoming pixels are drawn if their depth value is less than the stored value in the depth buffer. If the pixel is drawn, its value is also stored in the depth buffer - if the incoming (Source) pixel passes depth test, its value is combined with the stored color (Dest) using the following formula Final.RGB = Source.RGB * Source.A + Dest.RGB * (1 - Source.A)

isDitherEnabled().Description: Specifies whether colors are dithered before writing into the framebuffer

isDepthMaskEnabled().Description: Queries whether writes are enabled into the depth buffer

ClassDesc: ProgramStore contains a set of parameters that control how the graphics hardware handles writes to the framebuffer. It could be used to: enable/disable depth testing specify wheather depth writes are performed setup various blending modes for use in effects like transparency define write masks for color components written into the framebuffer
